concept.title: Qualifier Values and Boolean Operators
concept.shortdesc: If multiple values of the same qualifier are used, the Boolean operator, OR, is implied between the qualifiers.

conbody.p: For example, if you qualify a user to view employees from Company = To the Max Amusement Park and Company = UEL Corporate Tech, the user will be able to view all employees in either company. In addition, any employee being added to either company will be automatically visible to the user. For an employee to be auto-assigned to the group, he/she needs to meet only one of the qualifiers.

However, if multiple values of different qualifiers are used, the Boolean operator, AND, is implied between the qualifiers. For example, if you assign the user to view employees with Company = UEL Corporate Tech and Department = SYSM â€“ Systems Management, the user will only be able to view employees who are in the UEL Corporate Tech company and in the SYSM Systems Management department.
